release.action: Fixed critical issue: Loading keystore failed because of illegal password handling.
Code refactoring, cleaned up.
Fixed broken Unit tests on Linux platform (Connection issue).
IP black list support.
Console authentification bug fixed.
Global and group based transfer rate limits.
Made console servlets and associated resources configurable via spring application context.
Fixed JDK 1.4 incompatibility that inadvertently stole into release 0.11.

A web based administration console provides basic statistics about sessions, users, memory consumption etc. The console is disabled by default. It can be enabled by setting the application context option "console.enabled" to true.
Handling of client specific extensions to RFC 959 such as LIST -aL.
On Linux system with more than one network interfaces the loop back address has been used instead of the machine address. Hence, passive mode connections failed.
Service-Wrapper: version placeholder was not replaced.
Usermanager interface changed: Session context is passed to user manager on authentification.
Fixed bug concerning control channel flush.
JMeter load tests.
Enforcement of resource consumption limits.
Fixed various bugs concerning record handling.
Fixed issues concerning mulit-byte character sets.
Changed unit test FTP port to 2121 in order to enable non-root Unix users to execute the tests.
Modified FtpCmd interface.
Support for record Structure.
Support for block transmission mode.
Use Locale.US when returning directory to client.
Optimized multithreading.
Capability to define session timeout interval.
Anonymous login.
Fixed file timestamp format returned by LIST command.
Processing OPTS UTF ON (as required by Internet Explorer).
Implemented SIZE command.
Enforce security check on MDTM command.
Changed package names to "net.sf.hermesftp".
Remove keystore from classpath and updated documentation.
Security is enforced on executing RMD command.
Fixed unix/windows path separator issue.

release.desc: Hermes FTP Server with SSL support.
release.action: Security enforced through explicit/implicit SSL/TLS (RFC 2228).
Test client and unit tests implemented.
Extended FTP features, such as FEAT, OPTS implemented (RFC 2389).
Set up project structure, implemented internal infrastructure based on Spring Framework.
All basic FTP commands like STOR, RECV, LIST, PORT etc were implemented (RFC 959).
